It's a collectathon game that mainly rewards fucking around. Finding the games all hidden little easter eggs and hijinks. A game anyone can pick up and simply have a good time since there's no way to "lose". Everyone is immortal to a degree.

If you're the the type that likes achievement hunting, there's plenty to keep you busy. If you just wanna play through the game until you finished the "story", you get a fun and laidback experience.

Goat being goat.

Everyone's away hammering the Helldivers 2 servers, or rearing third-party Pokemon in PalWorld, yet here's me running around aimlessly as a goat, licking pavements, people and stuff that's on fire.

It's Goat Sim 3. If you know Goat Sim, you know you want to buy this - there's now a 3 at the end of the title, and your Goat can wear Crocs, which is all the upgrading that you need.
fun game
its a good game but overprice
Genuinely really good. Unfortunate it had a year delay before it came to steam but it was absolutely worth the weight, its the original silly game but as a fully realized experience lol

I was gonna try and see if I could turn on one of the outdoor showers by the spa, and accidentally broke it. The pipe went flying. As I move the camera around, I spotted a lady standing by the shower next to mine, staring at me, proclaiming calmly "That wasn't very nice", paused for a second, before bringing up her phone to photograph me at the scene of the crime. It was a profoundly real moment amids the wackyness and chaos.

On a serious note: Though I love the mindless fun, friend who join seem to time out after a while, and going back to title screen to re invite my screen goes black and I have to force close and restart completely. No idea what could be the issue, or if it differs for others and with split screens, settings or IP adresses etc. I hope they look into some of the tech issues. The game works okay single player (you can always respawn if stuck or bugged utterly), but of course it is even more fun to share w friends.

Also, have to say, so much of the NPC dialouge is soo incredibly Swedish: "I have no strong feelings whatsoever", "I have severe anger issues and you're not helping", "I'm sorry I just zoned out, what were you saying?", "I wish I was happy, because then I woulndn't be sad"...

If you wanna know what it's like to play a "Goat Simulator" game it's kind of like playing one of those animatronic light gun shooting gallery games where you shoot something and a bear pops out of an outhouse or you get an animation when you shoot a frying pan or something. It's kind of like that in a way. It's also a physics simulator. The whole point of this game is finding easter eggs, so it's kind of like a collect-a-thon crossed with a physics sandbox. Something about that combo is strangely addicting.
GTA ----firearms +++++goat

This game is just so baaaaaaad that it's beyond indescribably stupid. Just like the first Goat Simulator was. You're a goat acting like a goat. It's pointless, buggy, will never be fully QA tested/fixed and you run around acting totally clueless and reckless. But it's fun. It's just fun. And if you've got people to play with, it's even more fun. This game is just pure, simple, unadulterated, indescribable levels of fun. AND YOU GET TO BE AND ACT LIKE A GOAT THAT FARTS WHATEVER A GOAT FARTS. And that's why it belongs in your library. The first, last and only simulator game you will ever need (besides the first one of course).

Great choc chip cookie recipe

125g butter, softened
1/2 cup caster sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 egg
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups self-raising flour
1 cup choc chips

Cream butter and sugar, then add egg and vanilla, and beat well.

Mix in sifted flour and choc chips using a wooden spoon until well combined.

Place heaped teaspoons of mixture onto a lined tray, and press gently with a fork or fingers to slightly flatten.

Bake at 180C for 10-12 minutes or until golden in colour.

The best game I've ever played in the history of mankind.

I'm sure some people will hate this game because it's not exactly like the original, but it never could be and I love the direction they went with it. Overall a really fun game, a new game proper rather than a pile of shambling homages pretending to be a game (well, it kinda is that too but they're new memed homages or tasteful homages to the original game while still primarily relying on new goofs and mechanics). The physics and controls are the perfect ratio of good to garbage and they really put work into making the map as full and as silly as the original which is quite impressive. I definitely miss the original music, but I'm sure I'll live lol. Worth the money (to me) and I'm really hoping they plan to add more maps eventually (within an amount of time that is healthy and reasonable for the developers), I would absolutely pay for more.

Very good and hilarious game. Probably the funniest game I've ever played, and I've played some funny ones. Here are some things that the devs could think about adding;

1. A fire station (with interior)
2. A hospital (with interior)
3. A wider variety of cars
4. A military base (including tanks)
5. Helicopters/Planes
6. Boats

That's all. Once again, very fun game! Keep it up.

I still give the game a positive review because it can make me play for hours. However it isn't much interesting and almost nothing new compare to Goat Sim 1.
Below are the things I hope the game can improve:
- The map is much bigger, however it still has only two theme: the rural and the modern urban. Basically, it's just a bigger Goatville and Goat City Bay from 1. I hope there will be more DLC with totally different setting like the MMO and Space. 
- There are only about, like, 10 dialogues for all the NPCs, except the Farmer. I know it's part of the joke, and NPCs aren't much important, but hearing the same dialogue again and again throughout the entire game makes me feel so boring. It will be better if outside of the general dialogues, we have some different NPCs' dialogues for each area of the map. 
- A lot of collectibles require climbing high and/or flying to get. It makes more challenge, yes, but it's overused and sometimes frustrated to get. I don't mind doing a long quest, or finding in a hidden, surprised area for the collectibles. But put them just very high and require multi times jumping/ flying is meh.

I've been waiting so long for this game to come to Steam since I'm a classy person and do not associate with that other "Epic" business.  Please don't make us superior Steam humans wait again for a game this good, it was cruel. 

As for the game, I must say that it has all the feel of the first but with more! It's wonderful, happy, silly and full of things to do and mayhem to cause. I absolutely love it. My spouse and I had plans last night to go to bed early for some much needed love time if you know what I mean, but we got so much into playing the game together that before we knew it it was 2am and our plans were out the window. True story. Thank you for making such a fun game that we forgot that we wanted to make love.

I am a 98 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Daughter, who is 57 now. My daughter got this game for Hanukkah in 1941 from her physician, so we installed it on her computer and she started playing. By the end of the week she had 1.7 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my daughter, as she is always out with her friends or just emptying her colostomy bag. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside her. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Daughter for help and she hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Daughter since my hamster had died. This game has ever since brought me and my daughter closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the prison walls together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my daughter multiple happy memories.

I only bought this game again for my steam deck, and I was delighted and equally bemused to see it run so well. My computer struggled with the initial EGS launch.

I can get a little over 3 hours of playtime at medium graphics settings. I turned of V-sync and set the frame-rate and hertz rate to 40 (not in-game).

The parodies und fun details such as the ridiculous Oblivionesque NPC conversations make this game a hilarious experience even 9 years after the first goat simulator. I wanted to just check it out for a moment and the game pulled me from location to location with its silly landmarks that grab your attention and make you want to explore further.

Since I'm only 2h in so far I can't speak about longevity but hopefully the multiplayer and challenges allow for extra fun and encourage more experimentation with what's there.
